results.title: Peter combe plays chopsticks: and other collectable clips for kids
results.creator_credit: Catherine Shirley, Trish Foremen and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: This compilation of favourite Peter Combe songs is guaranteed to have kids singing and dancing. Peter’s famous “Chopsticks” song is included as well as “Saturday night”, “Wriggle and roll”, “Newspaper Mama”, “Music of the day”, “Spaghetti bolognaise”, “Toffee apple”, “Happy Christmas to you” and “Jack and the Beanstalk”, along with the two poems “Newspaper Mama visits the Queen” and “Very strange cat.”

results.title: DreamWorks: Inside the Studio
results.creator_credit: Sam Mapplebeck, Shelley Matulick, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Venture behind the scenes and uncover the history and creative process behind some of the world’s most popular animated films with this fascinating exploration of the DreamWorks Animation creative studio.

Join special international DreamWorks guests Bill Damaschke (Chief Creative Officer), Kendal Cronkhite (Production Designer), Christophe Lautrette (Production Designer), Jason Schleifer (Head of Character Animation) and Doug Cooper (Visual Effects Supervisor) as they take us inside the DreamWorks phenomenon and explore how the animation and artwork has evolved over the history of the studio’s many hit titles.

Offering key insights into the creative history of the studio and exploring the artwork that has inspired artists and animators all over the world, these talented DreamWorks creatives will also examine the joint curatorial process behind showcasing the art form in the groundbreaking ‘DreamWorks Animation: The Exhibition’ shown at ACMI from 10th April to 5th October 2014.

results.title: Peter Combe in: Spook the video clip
results.brief_description: A behind the scenes look at Peter Combe’s video clip, “Mr Spook” (produced by Carol Combe). You get to see the make-up, lighting, how the spooky special effects are created, as well as meeting the children who appear in the film clip; Fergus, Christopher, Rosie, Alice, Emily and Thomas. Mr Spook is superbly accompanied by The Australian String Quartet and filmed on location at the Carclew Youth Youth Arts Centre, North Adelaide. An entertaining program for Peter Combe fans as well as those children interested in the technical side of film making.

results.title: Peter Combe's Christmas under the stars
results.creator_credit: Stephen Jones, ABC-TV (Australia) and Impressa Visual Productions
results.brief_description: Entertainer, Peter Combe, celebrates the spirit of Christmas with this joyful family concert recorded live at the Adelaide Festival Centre in 1991. With the help of the Adelaide Girls’ Choir, Helen Beinke’s Dance Arts, Alice Combe on backing vocals and the Jingle Bells Band, Peter performs these songs - “Tell Me the Story”, “Rejoice, Rejoice”, “Christmas Child”, “Star Shines Bright”, “Hang Up Your Stocking”, “Ping”, “Baby Lying in a Manger”, “Christmas is Coming”, “Love & Joy”, “To You a Merry Christmas”, “Little Drummer Boy”, “Fear Not for I”, “O Little One”, “Silent Night”, “Mary’s Boy Child” and “Happy Christmas to You”.

results.title: Peter Beales: a celebration of old roses
results.creator_credit: Vivian Russell, Michelle Fox and Vivian Russell Incorporated
results.brief_description: For anyone interested in Old Roses, Peter Beales should be a familiar name as his nursery contains one of the world’s largest collections of Old Roses. In this documentary Peter takes the viewer on a potted history of Old Roses, from Species through to the Teas. He looks at their place in history and their evolution. The process of hybridizing is explained by Peter’s daughter, Amanda Gipp, and we watch the Beales family at the Sandringham and Royal Norfolk Shows. An eleven minute pictorial index of the roses discussed throughout the video is presented following the credits.
results.title_for_label: Peter Beales: a celebration of old roses

results.title: Dressed to kill
results.creator_credit: Roy William Neill and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Adapted from a story by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle and featuring the inimitable Sherlock Holmes (Basil Rathbone) and his sidekick, Dr Watson (Nigel Bruce). In this tale of mystery and suspense, Holmes has to find the whereabouts of three wooden music boxes containing Bank of England engraving plates in order to prevent certain crims out there from basically obtaining a licence to print money. Cast includes Patricia Morison, Edmond Breon, Frederick Worlock, Carl Harbord, Patricia Cameron.

results.title: Peter and the wolf: a Prokofiev fantasy, including the Classical symphony Overture on Hebrew themes and the March
results.creator_credit: Roger Law, Steve Bendelack, Christopher Swann, Frances Peters, Joanna Beresford and Spitting Swanns
results.brief_description: Peter and the Wolf is a long-established classic, but never before has it enjoyed such an unusual and exicitng visual treatment. This production features Claudio Abbado, Roy Hudd (as Prokofiev) and members of the Theatre de Complicite, and introduces Henry Feagins as Peter and some fantastic new ‘Spitting Image’ puppets. The result is a delightful visualization of the Russian composer and his universally beloved musical tale. Filled with hilarious caricature, this Prokofiev Fantasy mixes inspired puppetry with live action. Behind it is Sting’s riveting narration and, of course, Prokofiev’s immortal music - the Classical Symphony and Overture on Hebrew Themes as well as Peter and the Wolf - in bravura performances by The Chamber Orchestra of Europe conducted by Claudio Abbado.

results.title: Peter
results.creator_credit: Martina Amati, James Bolton, Cowboy Films, Film London, Fresh One Productions and Channel 4
results.brief_description: In a semi-empty swimming pool Peter engages in a series of very intense warming up and breathing exercises. He stretches, flexes, inhales and exhales to finally plunge in the water and re-emerges fully satisfied.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Martina Amati, James Bolton, Cowboy Films, Film London, Fresh One Productions and Channel 4

results.title: DreamWorks Animation Masterclass: Kendal Cronkhite
results.creator_credit: Jesse Taylorsmith, Shelley Matulick, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description:
At the heart of DreamWorks Animation is the desire to tell great stories and inspire audiences.

In a series of masterclass sessions, the creative team behind the studio that brought us ‘Kung Fu Panda’, ‘Shrek’ and ‘Madagascar’, gave an exclusive look inside the professional animation industry.

Kendal Cronkhite joined PDI/DreamWorks as an art director in its pioneering days and worked on the studio’s first computer animated film ‘Antz’.

Prior to joining the company, she served as a freelance editorial illustrator in Canada and New York. Cronkhite was also the assistant art director on Tim Burton’s ‘The Nightmare Before Christmas’ and the art director on Disney’s ‘James and the Giant Peach’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jesse Taylorsmith, Shelley Matulick, Kim Montgomery and ACMI

results.title: DreamWorks Animation Masterclass: Christophe Lautrette
results.creator_credit: Jesse Taylorsmith, Shelley Matulick, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description:
At the heart of DreamWorks Animation is the desire to tell great stories and inspire audiences.

In a series of masterclass sessions, the creative team behind the studio that brought us ‘Kung Fu Panda’, ‘Shrek’ and ‘Madagascar’, gave an exclusive look inside the professional animation industry.

Christophe Lautrette served the role of a Production Designer for DreamWorks Animation’s pre-historic family comedy, ‘The Croods’. During his tenure at DreamWorks Animation, Lautrette has worked as Art Director on various feature films, including ‘Prince of Egypt’, ‘Spirit: Stallion of the Cimarron’, ‘Kung Fu Panda’ and ‘Bee Movie’. He is also the main contributor to DreamWorks Animation’s first personal art publication ‘Moonshine’.

Lautrette is originally from France and he currently resides in Los Angeles, CA.
